etymology.description: 喇 (la sound) + 叭 (ba popping sound) = horn/trumpet; later extended to loudspeaker.
etymology.interpretation: Formed from sound-symbolic syllables imitating a brassy “la-ba” blast, it names instruments and devices that blare. Usage broadened to car horns and public loudspeakers.

examples.chinese: 他在乐队里吹喇叭(他在樂隊裡吹喇叭)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài yuèduì lǐ chuī lǎba.
examples.english: He plays the trumpet in the band.

examples.chinese: 开车别乱按喇叭(開車別亂按喇叭)。
examples.english: Don't honk the horn recklessly when driving.

examples.chinese: 广场的喇叭一直在广播通知(廣場的喇叭一直在廣播通知)。
examples.pinyin: Guǎngchǎng de lǎba yīzhí zài guǎngbò tōngzhī.
examples.english: The loudspeaker in the square keeps broadcasting announcements.
